alert.note: Alert for Cody Foothills; Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Lander Foothills; Natrona County Lower Elevations; North Big Horn Basin; Northeast Johnson County; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southeast Johnson County; Southwest Big Horn Basin; Wind River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 05 at 2:45AM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Hot Temperatures for Labor Day... This is a special weather statement from the National Weather Service Office in Riverton. * WHAT...Near record high temperatures. * WHERE...Northern and Central Wyoming. * WHEN...Labor Day. * HIGH TEMPERATURES...Middle to upper 90s. * IMPACTS...Hot temperatures will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Drink plenty of non-alcoholic fluids. When possible reschedule outdoor activities to early morning or evening, and take frequent breaks in the shade. Check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances.
